author: The Editorial Board
title: Hungary’s Lesson for Europe
text:
Viktor Orban won a third consecutive four-year term as Hungary’s prime minister on Sunday, and the big losers are everyone else. The vote is in particular a rebuff to the European Union, not that Brussels seems inclined to listen.
The parliamentary majority of Mr. Orban’s Fidesz party wasn’t in danger, but there was a chance the election would deprive him of the supermajority to amend the constitution at will. Instead he won 133 seats in the 199-seat legislature, just over the line, and he won a larger share of the popular...
